intro: Amoria talyschensis, commonly known as the Talyschenskaya bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
